DOC.brief_title: TEAM Study Improve Depression Care Rural CBOCs
DOC.detailed_description: BACKGROUND / RATIONALE : Implementing collaborative care depression small rural Primary Care ( PC ) practice without on-site mental health specialist present unique challenge . We adapt collaborative care model use telemedicine ( e.g. , telephone , interactive video , electronic medical record ) support antidepressant therapy initiated PC provider small rural practice . The Telemedicine Enhanced Antidepressant Management ( TEAM ) collaborative care intervention implement offsite personnel intervention component implement use telemedicine technology . OBJECTIVE ( S ) : Specific Aim 1 : Determine whether TEAM intervention improve quality outcome compare usual care . Specific Aim 2 : Determine whether TEAM intervention cost-effective routine practice setting . METHODS : Seven VISN 16 CBOCs participate study . CBOCs include 1 ) treat > 1,000 < 5,000 unique veteran , 2 ) on-site psychiatrist , 3 ) interactive video equipment . Matched CBOCs randomize receive intervention usual care . Of 24,882 clinic patient , 73.6 % ( n=18,306 ) successfully screen 6.9 % screen positive depression ( PHQ9 =12 ) . Of eligible study , 91.3 % agree participate , 91.9 % attend appointment consent . Over 18-month period , 395 patient enrol , 91.1 % ( n=360 ) followed-up six month . Telephone research interview conduct baseline , six twelve month . Effectiveness test use intent-to-treat analysis . Cost-effectiveness analysis assess perspective VA. Costs include intervention cost , encounter cost , medication cost . Quality Adjusted Life Years ( QALYs ) calculate use Quality Well Being Scale .
